p: Blood samples were collected and processed on site, using a mobile suitcase laboratory for viral identification. The mobile laboratory consisted of a glovebox (Bodo Koennecke, Berlin, Germany), a lab-in-a-suitcase [ 9, 10, 11], a solar panel and a power pack set (Yeti 400 set, GOALZERO, South Bluffdale, UT, USA, Figure 2). The mobile setup was organized into 2 stations: the extraction station with the glovebox, and the RPA in the suitcase laboratory. Inactivation and extraction of the samples were performed in the glovebox using a modified protocol of the Speedxtract kit (Qiagen, Lake Constance, Germany).
